revised_title: Catecholamine Effects on Guinea-Pig Taenia Coli in K-Free and Na-Free Solutions
tldr: The author studied the effects of catecholamines on the guinea-pig taenia coli in K-free and Na-free solutions and in the presence of ouabain. They found that the hyperpolarization produced by catecholamines, such as adrenaline and noradrenaline, mainly involves an increase in the K conductance of the membrane and does not activate the Na-pump.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Neurotransmitters and Receptors
